attributes.action: Create a new honour for community volunteers during the Coronavirus pandemic
attributes.additional_details: In my own community - as in many others - a local hall is a now a community hub, organised and manned by volunteers. This has included prescription collection and delivery, shopping deliveries (particularly during the panic buying phase), and has been a central point for grocery donations from local businesses. The team have worked non-stop to support those in need, and their actions have certainly limited illness and spread, as well as eased worry amongst the vulnerable. This needs recognition.
attributes.background: Create a new award - granted by the government and the Crown through nominations - to celebrate and recognise those individuals and groups who have been organising in their communities to support those in need during the Coronavirus pandemic. Their contribution has been outstanding.

rejection.details: Create a "Pandemic Voluntary Service Medal" to recognise Civilian Volunteers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315797
